name: Pahang
description: Pahang (Malay pronunciation: [paˈhaŋ]; Jawi: ڤهڠ‎), officially Pahang Darul Makmur with the Arabic honorific Darul Makmur (Jawi: دار المعمور‎, 'The Abode of Tranquility') is a sultanate and a federal state of Malaysia. It is the third largest Malaysian state by area and ninth largest by population. Pahang's capital and largest city, Kuantan, is the eighth largest urban agglomerations by population in Malaysia. The royal capital and the official seat of the Sultan of Pahang is located at Pekan. Modern Pahang is an economically important state with main activities in services, manufacturing and agricultural sectors. Pahang covers an area of 35,965 km2 (13,886 sq mi), and is the third largest state in Malaysia after Sabah and Sarawak, and the largest in the Peninsular Malaysia. Pahang is home to Malaysia's two important national parks, Taman Negara and Endau-Rompin, both located in the north and south of the state respectively.Peninsular Malaysia's highest peak, Mount Tahan, can be accessed via Pahang.Pahang also contains three of Peninsular Malaysia's major hill stations, at Cameron Highlands, Fraser's Hill and Genting Highlands. Each has been developed on a different concept. Cameron Highlands is famous for its sprawling tea plantations, butterflies, strawberries and honey bee farms.
